posts_data.title: Pelagic Presents: LLNN
posts_data.content:
We’re happy to have LLNN be part of Roadburn Redux in any way they see fit. And what they opted for was to give us a glimpse into their artistic process. This short - but impactful - video invites us to witness the creation of the sonic universe that surrounds them. We’re ready!

More LLNN.

posts_data.title: Album Premiere: MIGHT performing Might
posts_data.content:
Hannover-based husband and wife duo MIGHT recorded their eponymous debut album last March, just as the pandemic was engulfing the planet. Unable to play shows in the traditional sense, we’re pleased to present Might - here with us today making their international live debut at Roadburn Redux, playing the incredible album in full for the very first time. 

If you like what you hear, you can pick up a copy of the album here via Exile on Mainstream:

https://shop.mainstreamrecords.de/product-tag/might

posts_data.title: Blodet
posts_data.content: Having caught our eye at ESNS, we were delighted to be given the opportunity to raid the Blodet vaults - and came out with an awesome live recording. The track is called Vision, and it’s unreleased - so we managed to bag quite a scoop!

posts_data.title: Playlist: Rob Delaney's best stoner metal
posts_data.content:
Comedian, Rob Delaney (who co-writes and co-stars in the excellent TV show Catastrophe, as well as all sorts of fancy Hollywood films), is a not-so-secret lover of stoner rock and doom. A few weeks ago he compiled a list of contenders for 'the best stoner metal of all time' - deliberately omitting Sleep's Dopesmoker (correctly crowning this the overall champion, of course), and the more obvious suggestions of Kyuss and Sabbath. What was left is a hefty 10 hour playlist jammed full of riffs.

Anyway, we asked if we could share it here and he said yes! Thanks Rob!

You can follow him on Twitter here and tell him what classic track he missed out of the playlist!

posts_data.title: Haunted Plasma
posts_data.content:
Ahem... it seems something was somewhat haunting the technical end of the website last night and a glitch meant that we weren't able to deliver Haunted Plasma in all their glory at the allotted time. But if ever there was a band to make their performance debut twice, Haunted Plasma seem like a good candidate.

So consider this take II, or if you're seeing it for the first time, just get stuck in!


The phantoms at the beating nucleus of this unearthly machine are Juho Vanhanen (Oranssi Pazuzu, Grave Pleasures), Timo Kaukolampi (K-X-P, Op:l Bastards) and Tomi Leppänen (Circle, Aavikko, K-X-P), transmitting a music form evolved from a life of redefining sonic boundaries in their respective projects. Also featuring guest vocals from Mat McNerney (Hexvessel, Carpenter Brut, Beastmilk) and Ringa Manner (Ruusut, The Hearing).
